properties.Name: DirectEmissionsFromStationaryCombustionSources
properties.Description:
There are two main methods for estimating GHG emissions from stationary combustion sources:

- Direct measurement
- Analysis of fuel input 

For both the CEMS and fuel analysis approaches, it is recommended that organizations calculate emissions by facility as opposed to aggregated entity-wide emissions only. This method increases the accuracy and credibility of the inventory.

Columns.Name: ReportingLegalEntityId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Legal Entity.

Columns.Name: FuelBurnedInReportingPeriodUnits
Columns.Description: The units of fuel burned in the reporting period.

Columns.Name: FuelBurnedInReportingPeriodUomId
Columns.Description: The fuel burned in reporting period UOM.

Columns.Name: FuelPurchasedInReportingPeriodUnits
Columns.Description: The fuel purchased in the reporting period units.

Columns.Name: FuelPurchasedInReportingPeriodUomId
Columns.Description: The fuel purchased in reporting UOM.

Columns.Name: FuelStockAtStartOfReportingPeriodUnits
Columns.Description: The fuel stock at start of reporting period units.

Columns.Name: FuelStockAtEndOfReportingPeriodUnits
Columns.Description: The fuel stock at end of reporting period units.

Columns.Name: TotalCo2EEmissionsUomId
Columns.Description: The total CO2e emission UOM ID.

Properties.Description:
There are two main methods for estimating GHG emissions from stationary combustion sources:

- Direct measurement
- Analysis of fuel input 

For both the CEMS and fuel analysis approaches, it is recommended that organizations calculate emissions by facility as opposed to aggregated entity-wide emissions only. This method increases the accuracy and credibility of the inventory.
